title: Boiled Spinach
steps: Bring the water to a boil in a large pot.
Add the spinach, starting from the root end. Cook for 20-30 seconds.
Strain spinach and transfer to ice water to stop cooking.
Wring out the spinach of its residual water, shaping it into a firm log.
Cut the log into 2-inch pieces, then reserve as needed.
notes: Boiling spinach is not hard, and it's also a common topping, particularly in shoyu ramen.
Since the soup is often amply seasoned, the water used for cooking here does not need salt.
Feel free to add salt to the cooking water if you choose.
The quick cooking time preserves the color and texture of the spinach.
Shocking in ice water stops the cooking process and sets the bright green color.
Wringing out excess water prevents diluting the ramen soup.
Shaping into a log makes for uniform, attractive 2-inch pieces.
